name: Lights Out & Youtube Center Compatibility Fix
description: By default, the settings popup of Youtube Center (<abbr title="Youtube Center">YTC</abbr>) is all white and clashes quite severely with the dark colors of the "Youtube - Lights Out - A Dark Youtube Theme" (<abbr title="Youtube - Lights Out - A Dark Youtube Theme">YLO Theme</abbr>) userstyle. This userstyle applies the main and secondary colors of the <abbr title="Youtube - Lights Out - A Dark Youtube Theme">YLO Theme</abbr> userstyle to the settings popup of <abbr title="Youtube Center">YTC</abbr>, bringing the clashing light colors on dark colors conflict to a rightful end.

user.name: emabrey
user.about: I am a programmer and my creative output is mainly focussed on code. I occasionally throw together a useful CSS theme for myself however, and sharing them can only help. If you find anything wrong with a theme of mine please don't hesitate to contact me and let me know about the problem!

additional_info:
Release Notes:
(v1.1: 05/18/2015) Update project with references to GitHub repository
(v1.0: 05/16/2015) Released under the CC BY-NC-SA license

This userstyle is only a modification that makes the YTC extension/userscript and the YLO Theme userstyle compatible with one another. By default, the settings popup of YTC is all white and clashes quite severely with the dark colors of the YLO Theme. This userstyle applies the main and secondary colors of the YLO Theme to the settings popup of YTC, bringing the clashing white on black conflict to a rightful end.

If you find any bugs or need to request a feature please do so via the Github Issues- I will do my best to answer and address your issue. Please note that this CSS is not the paradigm of excellence and I would greatly appreciate any feedback on making it better. You may contribute changes via pull requests at the project's Github page.

The license terms of the YLO Theme requires me to give appropriate credit to Draxx7, who authored that userstyle and made it available here. Note that Draxx7 is not affiliated with this userstyle and that I am not affiliated with the YLO Theme. I want to personally thank Draxx7 for his userstyle however, as I use it personally and enjoy the aesthetic very much. Note that because I consider this userstyle as incorporating major parts (essentially design elements like colors) of the YLO Theme, I am licensing my userstyle using CC BY-NC-SA. Click here to get a copy of the CC BY-NC-SA license (redistribution is a required part of license compliance).

YTC is not mine either; however it is available under the MIT license via Jeppe Rune Mortensen. I absolutely want to thank Jeppe for his extension because it is one of the most necessary parts of my Youtube experience. If I did not have YTC odds are I would rarely if ever surf Youtube. You can get YTC via the Github hosted wiki here (I recommend using the developer version in the form of a userscript, but a native extension may be your preference).
